datastructures.trees

Interface Tree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of Object held by the Tree data structure.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinarySearchTree<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AVLBinarySearchTree, LinkedBinarySearchTree, RedBlackBinarySearchTree

    public interface Tree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>
    A standard interface for a Tree data structure. No assumption is made about whether the Tree is n-ary with a particular choice of n, whether it is balanced, complete, full, etc. Classes implementing this interface will specify the specific functionality and state of the Tree as well as its internal data storage mechanisms.
    Since:
    October 2013
    Author:
    Jason Filippou (jasonfil@cs.umd.edu)

        Queries the tree for emptiness
        Returns:
        true if the tree contains no elements

        Query the tree for its size (number of elements)
        Returns:

      • find

        T find(T element)
                                       throws EmptyTreeException
        Find the element in the tree. Throws an exception if it doesn't find it.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to be found
        Returns:
        A reference to the element in the tree and null if it's not there.
        Throws:
        EmptyTreeException - if the tree is empty.

      • preorder

        java.util.Iterator<T> preorder()
                                                               throws EmptyTreeException
        Generates a preorder traversal for the tree.
        Returns:
        An iterator which traverses the tree in preorder fashion. (left subtree-> node -> right subtree).
        Throws:
        EmptyTreeException - if the heap is empty.

      • inOrder

        java.util.Iterator<T> inOrder()
                                                              throws EmptyTreeException

      • postOrder

        java.util.Iterator<T> postOrder()
                                                                throws EmptyTreeException
        Generates a postorder traversal for the tree.
        Returns:
        An iterator which traverses the tree in postorder fashion. (left subtree->right subtree -> node).
        Throws:
        EmptyTreeException - if the heap is empty.

      • levelOrder

        java.util.Iterator<T> levelOrder()
                                                                 throws EmptyTreeException
        Generates a breadth-first search (BFS) of the tree (level-order traversal).
        Returns:
        An iterator which traverses the tree breadth-first.
        Throws:
        EmptyTreeException - if the heap is empty.
